item.title: Developing using Docker inside of a container
item.description: This guide assumes familiarity with Linux command-line operations, Docker, and Fedora Atomic concepts. For the last six years or so I’ve been running Fedora Atomic as my daily driver; an immutable version of Fedora that uses Flatpaks and containers rather than installing packages to the host OS. This means the base operating system is read-only, making direct installation of packages like Docker challenging within the host environment. One complication is that so many projects use docker for building which is not supported inside of a container.
